suncertify.rmi
Class ContractorManagerRemoteImpl

java.lang.Object
  java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
      java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
          java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
              suncertify.rmi.ContractorManagerRemoteImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.rmi.Remote, ContractorManagerRemote, BusinessServices, RemoteObservable
public class ContractorManagerRemoteImpl
extends java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
implements ContractorManagerRemote

Server-side skeleton implementation of the remote contractor manager. Wrapper for the ContractorManager where the real work is relayed to.

In addition: (i) Throws RemoteException (unlike ContractorManager which doesn't know anything about remote stuff). (ii) Remote observable being observed by client views and used to broadcast the termination message.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Lars Kuettner
See Also:
ContractorManagerConnector, Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

ContractorManagerRemoteImpl

public ContractorManagerRemoteImpl(java.lang.String databaseLocation)
                            throws ServicesException,
                                   java.rmi.RemoteException
Creates an instance of the remote contractor manager implementation class. This instance is to play the role of the server-side model in the overall model-view-controller (MVC) setting.

Parameters:
databaseLocation - the path name to the database file
Throws:
ServicesException - on any database-related error
java.rmi.RemoteException - on network error
Method Detail

terminate

public final void terminate()
Terminates the remote contractor manager implementation instance. Entails broadcasting a notification message about the imminent server shutdown to all registered observers (typically network clients). Moreover, the embedded contractor manager is explicitly terminated.

search

public final java.util.Map<java.lang.Long,Contractor> search(java.lang.String name,
                                                             java.lang.String location)
                                                      throws ServicesException,
                                                             java.rmi.RemoteException
Description copied from interface: BusinessServices
Searches the database for all contractor records with a given name and/or location, and returns a collection of the matching records together with their record numbers for further reference. The search items must match exactly, or be null meaning anything matches.

Specified by:
search in interface BusinessServices
Parameters:
name - A string representing the contractor name to search for. If not null, an exact match is required. If null, embraces all records.
location - A string representing the location to search for. If not null, an exact match is required. If null, embraces all records.
Returns:
a map of all matching (record number, contractor) pairs
Throws:
ServicesException - if an unexpected problem with the data access class is encountered
java.rmi.RemoteException - if a problem with the remote invocation via RMI is encountered. Only relevant in a network setting. In a standalone setting, this exception is guaranteed never to be thrown.

book

public final BookResult book(long recNo,
                             Contractor contractor)
                      throws ServicesException,
                             java.rmi.RemoteException
Description copied from interface: BusinessServices
Attempts to book a record given by its record number. Successfully booking the record in this context means updating the record with the contractor provided. A record should only be updated if it:
  1. is still a valid record, that is, if it has not been deleted,
  2. has not been intermittently updated or replaced, and
  3. has not been booked by some other agent

Specified by:
book in interface BusinessServices
Parameters:
recNo - the record number of the record to book acting as the primary key into the database
contractor - the Contractor object with which to update the record pending the above-mentioned constraints
Returns:
A BookResult object representing the result of the booking operation. Consists of the BookStatus and the Contractor object post-booking.
Throws:
ServicesException - if an unexpected problem with the data access class is encountered. A record having been intermittently deleted does not trigger this exception as this should be reckoned with.
java.rmi.RemoteException - if a problem with the remote invocation via RMI is encountered. Only relevant in a network setting. In a standalone setting, this exception is guaranteed never to be thrown.

Adds an observer to the set of observers for an observable object, provided that it is not the same as some observer already in the set. The order in which notifications will be delivered to multiple observers is not specified.

notifyObservers

public final void notifyObservers()
                           throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Description copied from interface: RemoteObservable
If the observable object has changed, as indicated by the hasChanged method, then notify all of its observers and then call the clearChanged method to indicate that the object has no longer changed.

This method will notify its observers with null as an argument.

Specified by:
notifyObservers in interface RemoteObservable
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - on network error
See Also:
Observable.notifyObservers()

notifyObservers

public final void notifyObservers(java.rmi.Remote r)
                           throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Description copied from interface: RemoteObservable
If the observable object has changed, as indicated by the hasChanged method, then notify all of its observers and then call the clearChanged method to indicate that the object has no longer changed.

Notifies observers of a change with the specified remote reference as an argument.

Specified by:
notifyObservers in interface RemoteObservable
Parameters:
r - the remote object to be passed to the observers
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - on network error
See Also:
Observable.notifyObservers(Object)
